title: Why an University WebApp?
text: What I wanted to make was a big, all-in-one webapp that featured all the necesarry skills I would need to learn and polish, but at the same time I needed something that was easy enough for me to do without suffering from burnout, so I got to thinking, and thinking got to searching, and searching got to asking an AI for help, and when all that failed, I went to a website I had found called 'sharpen.design'. The website is essentially a challenge creator for designers, using names and random number generators to create a challenge that you then went up and made for your portfolio. So, when I went into the website, it created the perfect challenge for me: 'Design a management app for UC Berkely'. Challenge I ended up modifying to 'Create a Homepage and entire Campus' for a ficticious University.

title: Why 'Claymore University'?
text: The name Claymore was the name of the discord server that my friends and I created and used since 2015, the artist of the group created a logo for it and we were all happy that it looked professional and cool. It just felt natural for me to create the webapp with that name.

title: The start of the journey
text: I created the repository on the 24 of February 2023 and worked on it on and off throughout 6 months before commiting to a Redesign and changing from Create-react-app to Vite + Typescript for scalability.
